DOC.HEAD: U.S., French Officials Discuss Drug Efforts
DOC.TEXT: The chief drug control strategists for the United States and France said after a meeting Wednesday that they will join in the fight against drugs even though they face different kinds of problems. ``The drug problem in France is essentially linked to heroin,'' Georgina Dufoix said after a meeting with William J. Bennett, director of the U.S. Office of National Drug Control Policy. ``Cocaine has not so far penetrated our territory as much as we feared it would,'' she said in comments made through a translator. Bennett said the discussion focused on Ms. Dufoix's questions on U.S. efforts _ ``What's going on here, what works, what we're seeing.'' ``She admitted France is quite concerned about its problems,'' Bennett said. ``It appears that they've been growing as the drug criminals try to extend their reach and build their markets.'' Bennett said he expected to continue the discussion with Ms. Dufoix ``perhaps in France later next year.''
